description.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to resilient, equitable use of safe and adequate gender- sensitive water and sanitation services with increased hygiene knowledge and attitude focusing on children under 5 in rural areas

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: "UNICEF Programmes in Ethiopia (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2016 Ethiopia: Joint Action Plan implementation in eight water insecure woredas in Afar regional state
2016 Ethiopia: Outcome evaluation of community-led total sanitation and hygiene (CLTSH)
2019 Ethiopia: Formative evaluation of UNICEF Ethiopia Country Program Evaluation Report
Ethiopia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Ethiopia Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to resilient, equitable use of safe and adequate gender- sensitive water and sanitation services with increased hygiene knowledge and attitude focusing on children under 5 in rural areas

description.narrative: UNICEF coordinated the COVID-19 response with key stakeholders after the first case was recorded in Ethiopia at the beginning of March 2020. The prevalence of the COVID epidemic and subsequent movement restrictions put in place by Government has affected the implementation of development activities specifically the construction works. UNICEF led the conceptualization of climate resilient WASH programming and as a result of the successes achieved by UNICEF the Government of Ethiopia (GoE) through its flagship programme, the One WASH National Programme (OWNP) is rolling out Climate Resilient WaSH (CR-WaSH) service provision demonstrating humanitarian/development linkages. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a national plan with target to provide access to drinking water to unserved populations

actual.value: 2020:The One WASH National programme document is being implemented. The plan has components of climate resilient WASH to address equity.

title.narrative: National Monitoring system capturing data on behavioral change information

actual.value: 2020:Concept notes on monitoring of Sanitation (Sanitation MIS) is being developed. The MIS is planned to include indicators on behavioural change communication

title.narrative: % of CWA funds used for gender and disability friendly institutional WASH

actual.value: 2020:As per administrative data from the regions, 12% of the CWA budget was allocated to institutional WASH.

title.narrative: WASH sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available

actual.value: 2020:Climate Resilient WASH and Low land WASH are components of phase II of OWNP and being implemented.
